title: I'm 17 and I have Asperger's syndrome and I'm thinking about writing a book about a 17 year old with ASD and his life up until this point. Should I? - Quora

response.answer_text: It doesn’t matter if you have a certain condition or not. You can write anything you want as long as you want to write it. If you feel as if writing the story is something that you want to do, don’t hesitate to do so. No one will judge you or your story just because you are 17 years old and have Asperger’s syndrome. It is about the quality and the unfolding of how you structure and create your story or book. That is what makes a work of art beautiful. Everyone has a different style and way of constructing their stories or books. What matters is your own unique style and that you express it, not how you have this and this condition. Your condition doesn’t matter when writing books. Even Stephen Hawking wrote a book even though he had ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis). Don’t let your condition get in the way of writing the things you want to write. You can write anything you want to write.

Why not? It will have a lot of benefits for you. Ability to speak your mind which I guess is hard for you now. An opportunity to deal with stuff that bothers you , you will feel better after writing about hard stuff for you, if it helps other people, why wouldn’t it help you? Perseverance, just start with 1 page everyday and stick to it. Maybe that will become a well-known book? Don’t take under consideration only the chance to get money. Think about influence on the people that struggle with the same problem as you.
